intro: Erigeron gonzaloi, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces showy blue to purple ray flowers surrounding a yellow disk, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron gonzaloi is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
